definition: to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to transport under guard
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
surname Xie

sentences.english: There are many ways to dispel your pent-up fury besides drinking!
sentences.chinese: 排解自己积愤的方法有很多种，不一定要喝酒呀。

sentences.english: Don’t tell me that you have the habit of punching the wall to vent your frustration.
sentences.chinese: 你不会告诉我你只会打墙来排解你心中的挫败感吧？

sentences.english: Who can not troubleshoot for him his father had a favorite child's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 没有谁能排解得了一个父亲对他最爱的孩子的思念。

sentences.english: Many people, especially women, deal with stress by overeating.
sentences.chinese: 许多人，尤其是女性，以暴饮暴食来排解压力。

sentences.english: One of the best ways to do that is to release it is through physical exercise.
sentences.chinese: 其中最好的一个方法就是通过体育运动来排解怒气。

sentences.english: William: Don't eat for the wrong reason. This can happen when people are feeling depressed or lonely.
sentences.chinese: 不要借助吃来排解压抑和孤独，那是错误的。

sentences.english: They rushed clamorously into the presence of the lioness and demanded of her the settlement of the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 牠们喧闹地涌到母狮面前，请牠来排解纠纷。

sentences.english: The differences between the two parties won't be healed as they insist on their own terms.
sentences.chinese: 由于双方固执己见，他们之间的分歧将无法予以排解。

sentences.english: Friends mediated between them in the dispute.
Eat teeth and bold, how also acid is generated.
sentences.chinese: 吃的牙齿和胃酸溜溜的，怎么也无处排解。

sentences.english: When it came to the first days at my arrival, I was so eager to watch much televesion so that I could learn a good English and get away with loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 刚到时我想多看电视，既学英文，又排解寂寞。

sentences.english: Wang Zhilan had to use martial to relieve the pain in mind.
sentences.chinese: 王芷兰只好用练武来排解心中的苦痛。

definition: to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
depressed/dejected/feeling low
moody/gloomy
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to give vent to (one's feelings)
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
depressed/gloomy
depressed/despondent/gloomy/depression
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
mood/state of mind/moodiness/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to express (an emotion)/to give vent
to eliminate/to dispel/resolution
